Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery grooved vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip, traces of cord-marked decoration survive around shoulder, and remains of incised Coptic (?) signs.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394288) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394288)
